Public interfaces¶

class features.Preprocessing[source]¶

Class containing functions for data

add_features(dataframe)[source]¶

Add columns with derived features

age_binning(dataframe)[source]¶

Create a column with AGE_AT_SCAN binning and attach to dataframe

com_harmonization(dataframe, confounder='SITE_CLASS', covariate='AGE_AT_SCAN')[source]¶

Harmonize dataset with ComBat model

feature_selection(dataframe, feature='AGE_AT_SCAN', plot_heatmap=False)[source]¶

Gives a list of the feature whose correlation with the given feature is higher than 0.5

file_reader(file_url)[source]¶
Parameters

file_url (string-like) -- The string containing data adress to be passed to Preprocessing.

neuro_harmonization(dataframe, confounder='SITE', covariate1='AGE_AT_SCAN')[source]¶

Harmonize dataset with neuroHarmonize model. 1-Load your data and all numeric covariates 2-run harmonization and store the adjusted data

plot_boxplot(dataframe, featurex, featurey)[source]¶

Boxplot of featurey by featurex

plot_histogram(dataframe, feature)[source]¶

Plot histogram of a given feature on the indicated group, masking values <0

site_binning(dataframe)[source]¶
Create a map where SITE is binned in the column SITE_Class

and then merge it withe dataframe

class regression.Regression[source]¶

Class describing regression model. :param dataframe: The dataframe tio be passed to the class. :type dataframe: datframe-like

k_fold(X, y, n_splits, model)[source]¶

Split the data and test it on a model chosen by the user

stratified_k_fold(X, y, y_bins, n_splits, model)[source]¶

Split the data preserving distribution and test it on a model chosen by the user model is the pipeline

class deeplearning.Deep(dataframe)[source]¶

Class describing deep regression model. :param file_url: The path that point to the data. :type file_url: string-like

make_MLP()[source]¶

This function uses generates an MLP model. :param Returns: :param model: the trained model. :param history: a summary of how the model trained (training error, validation error).

make_autoencoder()[source]¶

Autoenoder trained comparing the output vector with the input features using the Mean Squared Error (MSE) loss function. Returns: model: the trained model. history: a summary of how the model trained (training error, validation error).

plot_training_validation_loss(history)[source]¶

This function plots the training and validation loss curves of the trained model, enabling visual diagnosis of underfitting (bias) or overfitting (variance). :param history:

Returns

a visual representation of the model's training loss and validation loss curves.

Return type

fig

reconstruction_error(model)[source]¶

This function calculates the reconstruction error and displays a histogram of the training mean absolute error. Arguments: model: the trained model

x_train: 3D data to be used in model training (dataframe). Returns: fig: a visual representation of the training MAE distribution.

BrainAge
